images.description: carnivores named for the elongated bladelike canine teeth, which in some species were up to 50cm long
an enormous mammal, believed to be closely related to the modern-day elephant
an extinct flightless bird that inhabited Mauritius, the Dodo was about one meter tall and may have weighed 10â€“18 kg
images.date: the last widely accepted sighting of a Dodo was in 1662

images.imgLocation: North Atlantic and as far south as Northern Spain
images.description: a large and flightless bird that was a powerful swimmer which helped it to hunt underwater for food
images.date: the last of these birds was killed by three men who caught it on St Kilda, Scotland in 1844

images.imgLocation: inhabited the Near Islands, southwest of Alaska and the Commander Islands in the Bering Sea
images.description: large herbivorous mammal that is believed that Stellers Sea Cow which grew to at least 8-9 meters and weighed around 8-10 tons
images.date: named after George Steller, a naturalist who discovered the creature in 1741, and hunted to extinction within 27 years of discovery
